Sequence Information.Peptide Name: MPC-A8K (Mastoparan C A8K, Synthetic AMPs, Lys-rich; Leu-rich; XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (92.86%) toMastoparan CL: 36%; K: 29%.Activity: active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 32 uM), B. cereus ATCC 11778 (MIC 8 uM), E. faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC 4 uM), L. monocytogenes ATCC 15313 (MIC 4 uM), Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 8 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 64 uM), S. enterica ATCC 13076 (MIC 64 uM), and fungi C. albicans ATCC 10231 (MIC 16 uM).Toxicity: human RBC, HC50 ~64 uM, hemolytic.
Literature Information.Author: Thi Phuong HB, Huy BL, Van KN, Thi ND, Thi TB, Thi Hai YN, Thanh TB, Xuan HL, Thi Thanh BN. 2023
Literature Information.Reference: ACS Med Chem Lett. 2023 Dec 22;15(1):69-75. doi: 10.1021/acsmedchemlett.3c00385.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Reducing Self-Assembly by Increasing Net Charge: Effect on Biological Activity of Mastoparan C.
